content.description: The route is located a bit up the trail to Boyden, so check in with the shop and let your intentions be known out of courtesy. The route is on the slab of the Boyden wall, on the right side of the trail. It's a fun slab climb with a short crux and good friction on high quality rock.
content.protection:
7 Bolts to a 3 bolt anchor with webbing. bring webbing in case you have to replace the old. Some of the bolts are getting quite a bit old and/or worn down but the route was retro bolted so what used to be a 10a run-out is now protected by three newer bolts.

It wouldn't hurt to bring your own bolting kit. especially for the Anchor, and chains as well.
content.location: Up the trail to Boyden across from the grey generator building, about 50' off the trail. look for the bolts.

content.description: The route is slightly overhanging with good holds in all the right places. The three bolts on the route are a bit spread out with potential for long falls but you're not too likely to bottom out, if clips aren't blown and your belayer is all there. The walk around to set up a top-rope is loose, exposed, and sketchy. You're somewhat likely to knock rocks down onto cars or people that might be parked near. if you're desiring to set up a top rope instead of lead, use extreme caution.
content.location: The route is located at the end of the Boyden Cavern parking lot. It's on the left of the jutting-out tan rock. Park & Climb.
